result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Diane Chappell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2, same terms and conditions.

miscConds.notes: To be paid during the term of probation.

Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, AODA treatment and domestic violence counseling as well as any other treatment or counseling deemed appropriate by Agent. 
No violent or abusive or disorderly contact with: B.Z.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Diane Chappell

defendant.name: Chappell, Kayla Diane
defendant.address: N7976 County Hwy CC, Belleville, WI 53508

records.addlTxt: 9:00 AM Defendant Kayla Diane Chappell not in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Kayla Diane Chappell.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Kohl requests a bench WA, body only, state of Wisconsin. ADA Kohl requests the bench warrant be stayed in case the DE shows up to court. The Court grants the bench warrant. The DE appeared in person 5 minutes after hearing was called. Atty Krueger Smith speaks with the DE. The Court recalls the case at 9:16AM. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. The defendant entered a plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2. Count 3 to be dismissed but read in. The Court finds the DE guilty of counts 1 and 2 and directs a JOC be entered with the conditions being a withheld sentence and have the DE on probation for a period of 2 years on each count, pay the costs of the action, No violent or abusive or disorderly contact with: B.Z, the DE will need to complete AODA and domestic abuse and any other treatment deemed appropriate by their agent, the sentence is to run concurrent to each count 1 and 2. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
